title: Design and Utilization of Self-Assessment Tools for Strengthening Mathematical Workforce Competencies via Flipped Learning

context.prior_knowledge: Elementary mathematics curriculum knowledge and comprehension of flipped learning principles
context.additional_context: Establishing a smartphone-based, accessible flipped learning environment for in-service elementary mathematics instructors.

learning_goals: In a flipped learning environment, learners can utilize self-assessment tools to measure weekly learning outcomes with 80% or higher accuracy
Through VR simulations, learners can record and develop improvement plans for self-reflection processes in the flipped learning model three or more times
By comparing peer evaluations and self-evaluations at the end of the 6-month course, learners can revise two or more learning strategies

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
